intro: Navarretia peninsularis, commonly known as the Peninsular navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the coastline, where it thrives in full sun. Navarretia peninsularis is known for its rapid growth cycle, completing its life cycle within a single growing season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
